An EPFL student's project

About the project

In the frame of the Applied Data Analysis course of fall 2017 at EPFL.

The popular media is an (imperfect) mirror of the society. In this project, we want to study the effect of social trends and events of the 20th century on TV/Radio broadcasts. The 20th century saw the invention and ubiquity of the broadcast media: first radio and then television. Having access to a wealth of information about TV/Radio emissions all the way from 1930â€™s until today, we believe we can track these events and gain unique insights into the evolution of Swiss society.

Themes over the years

  1. => LEO What type of programs were produced in each time period? What/Who are the dominant themes/characters for the different historical periods ?
  2. => LEO General evolution of the emissions: How long does a show run (how many seasons)? What are the influence factors ? Is it linkable to the audience type ?

To have an ensemble view on the topics of the programs, the number of occurencies of each word by year was added.
